rhea_intro.text: If it's broken, I can probably fix it. If Vault-Tec built it, I can definitely break it.

rhea_about_harlan.text: Harlan Voss? Ranger with a busted rifle and a worse attitude. Good man, though. Loyal.

rhea_about_jax.text: Jax was sharp. Too sharp. Vault-Tec loves kids like that. They call it 'potential'. I call it 'target'.

rhea_reacts_overseer_voice.text: That voice isn't synthetic. That's a human pattern running on a machine. Someone got uploaded.

rhea_realization_jax_ai.text: Wait... that’s Jax? They shoved his mind into the Overseer core? That’s not tech, that’s torture.

rhea_about_vault77_systems.text: Vault 77's architecture is a nightmare. Redundant loops, dead-end circuits, and a core that was never meant to hold a person.

rhea_about_body.text: The ghoul body’s running on instinct. Higher functions are gone. Like a machine missing its processor.

rhea_body_reacts.text: See that? It responds to the Overseer’s voice. That’s a resonance link. Biological hardware still remembers the original firmware.

rhea_warning_sync.text: Mind-body sync is risky. Could stabilize. Could fry both. Vault-Tec never finished the research for a reason.

rhea_finalA_peace.text: Shutting him down was the safest option. Clean. Final. No more suffering.

rhea_finalB_wander.text: Letting the body go was smart. It’s functional enough to survive. The mind stays safe in the system.

rhea_finalC_sync.text: He’s syncing. Mind and body. I don’t know how long it’ll hold, but damn… that’s one hell of a miracle.

rhea_aftermath.text: Vault-Tec built horrors. But sometimes, the wasteland builds something new out of the wreckage.
